2009/12/10 openmind767 <openmind767@...>
>
> The whole NEAT lib and experiment are both full of branch. Making the whole things running on CUDA won't speed up, and it is
> not my target.

Hi,

So your saying that we:

1) Load all of the networks in a population into the GPU
2) Activate them in parallel.
3) Read the outputs.

For larger networks (e.g. from HyperNEAT) we may only get one or two
networks into the GPU, so it would seem we need to put as many
networks as we can into the GPU at a time. I think this should be
fairly easy to do and this touches on previous comments from Ken Lloyd
who I believe has gone into this in far more detail - e.g. by also
loading problem domain code into the GPU and trying to determine how
best to divide GPU and CPU resources in the general case (for a wide
range of scenarios).

Colin.
